itemDescription: Bishop of London; Archbishop of Canterbury; Lord Chancellor (1317-1381)

wikipedia_page.main: Simon Sudbury (c. 1316 – 14 June 1381) was Bishop of London from 1361 to 1375, Archbishop of Canterbury from 1375 until his death, and in the last year of his life Lord Chancellor of England. He met a violent death during the Peasants' Revolt in 1381.
